qas.question: When were the western towers built?
Who built the western towers of the abbey?
What kind of marble was used for the walls and floors of the abbey?
Under whom did the 19th century rebulding occur?
What were the two western towers built from?
When were the eastern towers built?
Who built the eastern towers of the abbey?
What kind of marble was used for the ceilings of the abbey?
Under whom did the 18th century rebulding occur?
What were the three western towers built from?

context: The abbey's two western towers were built <a0_0><b5_0>between 1722 and 1745<b5_0/><a0_0/> by <a1_0><b6_0>Nicholas Hawksmoor<b6_0/><a1_0/>, constructed from <a4_0><b9_0>Portland stone<b9_0/><a4_0/> to an early example of a Gothic Revival design. <a2_0><b7_0>Purbeck<b7_0/><a2_0/> marble was used for the walls and the floors of Westminster Abbey, even though the various tombstones are made of different types of marble. Further rebuilding and restoration occurred in the 19th century under <a3_0><b8_0>Sir George Gilbert Scott<b8_0/><a3_0/>.
